name: Anne Frank House
description: Museum house where Anne Frank & her family hid from the Nazis in a secret annex, during WWII.

name: Rijksmuseum
description: 19th-century building housing Dutch Golden Age painting masterpieces & vast European art collection.

name: Van Gogh Museum
description: Museum housing the world's largest collection of Van Gogh paintings, alongside drawings & letters.

name: Vondelpark
tagline: Huge park with an open-air theater
description: Expansive, 19th-century urban park with a playground, ponds & an open-air theater.

name: Dam Square
tagline: Grand square dominated by Royal Palace
description: Central public square & popular gathering place since the 17th century, flanked by the Royal Palace.

name: Heineken Experience
description: Interactive tour through beer giant's history in former brewery, with a tasting room finale.

name: Royal Palace of Amsterdam
tagline: Ornate Golden Age palace & royal venue
description: Grand residence for royal receptions since 1808, open to the public & exhibitions when not in use.

name: Jordaan
description: The narrow canals and streets of trendy Jordaan are flanked by indie boutiques, cozy pubs and hip eateries. Stalls at the Noordermarkt square market offer jewelry, clothes, antiques and organic

name: Leidseplein
description: Vibrant square, a hub for nightlife, entertainment, public transportation, shopping & dining.

name: Madame Tussauds Amsterdam
description: Museum chain for life-size wax replicas of famous Americans & historic icons in themed galleries.

name: Oude Kerk, Amsterdam
tagline: Cultural center in oldest city building
description: 13th-century church, now Calvinist, hosting religious & cultural activities including concerts.

name: Rembrandt House Museum
description: Restored, 17th-century house where Rembrandt lived & worked for 20 years, hung with his etchings.

name: Science Center NEMO
description: Interactive science exhibits, experiments & shows in a huge, waterfront, boat-like museum.

name: Stedelijk Museum Amsterdam
description: Contemporary museum with appearance of large bathtub, showing international, modern art & design.

name: Natura Artis Magistra
description: Zoo park founded in 19th century, with chimps, zebras & elephants, plus aquarium & planetarium.

name: Bloemenmarkt
description: Flower market dating from 1862, displaying blooms from tulips to geraniums on floating barges.

name: Singel
tagline: Canal, market, and canals of amsterdam
description: The Singel is a canal in Amsterdam which encircled the city in the Middle Ages. It served as a moat around the city until 1585, when Amsterdam expanded beyond the Singel. The canal runs from

name: Nieuwe Kerk, Amsterdam
description: Exhibition space in a medieval church that hosts royal weddings, ceremonies & organ recitals.

name: Amsterdam Museum
tagline: Museum tracing the history of the city
description: Former orphanage with artwork, artifacts & interactive exhibitions tracing the city's history.

name: Begijnhof, Amsterdam
description: Former women's religious community, with houses & a serene courtyard dating to the 15th century.

name: Albert Cuyp Market
tagline: Busy market with an array of offerings
description: Iconic street market since 1905 with lots of stands selling clothing, local foods, flowers & more.

name: Westerkerk
description: A crown-topped spire rises from this Renaissance-era Protestant church where Rembrandt is buried.

name: Rembrandtplein
description: street in Nijverdal, the Netherlands

name: IJ
tagline: River, canal, and canals of amsterdam
description: The IJ is a body of water, formerly a bay, in the Dutch province of North Holland. It is known for being Amsterdam's waterfront. Its name is from an obsolete Dutch word meaning "water". The name

name: Nieuwmarkt
description:
Nieuwmarkt is a square in the centre of Amsterdam, Netherlands. The surrounding area is known as the Lastage neighborhood. It is situated in the borough of Amsterdam-Centrum.
The square is considered

name: De Pijp
description: Bohemian De Pijp's narrow streets are lined with Middle Eastern eateries, old-school pubs and cafes with sidewalk terraces. Gregarious stallholders at Albert Cuypmarkt sell Dutch specialties

name: The National Maritime Museum
description: Interactive museum in former storehouse with virtual voyages & replica, 18th-century merchant ship.

name: Spui
description: The Spui is a square in the centre of Amsterdam, the capital of the Netherlands. The Spui was originally a body of water that formed the southern limit of the city until the 1420s, when the Singel

name: Magere Brug
tagline: Narrow, historic bridge lit at night
description: A popular historic site, this narrow bridge for pedestrians & cyclists is illuminated at night.

name: Hermitage Amsterdam
description: Dutch branch of St. Petersburg's art & culture museum with regularly changing temporary exhibitions.

name: Concertgebouw, Amsterdam
description: Landmark 19th-century concert hall with renowned acoustics for orchestral, chamber & pop music.

name: Ons' Lieve Heer op Solder
description: Audio tours of enigmatic, 17th-century house with an ornate catholic church hidden on the top floor.

name: Grachtengordel
description: The Grachtengordel is a neighborhood in Amsterdam, Netherlands located in the Centrum district. The seventeenth-century canals of Amsterdam, located in the center of Amsterdam, were added to

name: National Monument
tagline: Memorial to the dead, erected in 1952
description: White travertine monument with relief sculpting & the national site for the remembrance of WWII.

name: Amsterdam Dungeon
description: Theatrical, gore-laden attraction, part of a global chain, featuring gruesome local history.

name: Zaan
description: The Zaan is a small river in the province of North Holland in the northwestern Netherlands and the name of a district through which it runs. The river was originally a side arm of the IJ bay

name: Hortus Botanicus
description: Compact botanical gardens, originally planted in 1682, with formal outdoor & greenhouse sections.

name: Munttoren
description: Originally part of the city wall, this tower was rebuilt in 1620 & features a carillon with bells.

name: Tropenmuseum
description: Art objects, photos, music & film from non-Western cultures, including regular kids' exhibitions.

name: Foam Fotografiemuseum Amsterdam
description: Eclectic photography exhibition program in museum in 18th-century, canalside house with airy atrium.

name: Museum of Bags and Purses
tagline: Museum of bags & purses in old townhouse
description: 1666 canal house with displays tracing the history of the western ladies' bag over 500 years.

name: Joods Historisch Museum
description: Artworks, ceremonial items & other objects relating to Jews in Netherlands & its former colonies.

name: Museum Van Loon
description: Fine canal-house museum with a varied collection of paintings, furniture, silver and porcelain.

name: Diamond Museum Amsterdam
description: Attraction with displays about the geology of diamonds, ornate replica crowns & a jewelry store.

name: Muiden Castle
description: Restored & striking 13th-century moated castle with ramparts & hands-on museum, plus formal gardens.

name: Basilica of St. Nicholas, Amsterdam
tagline: Historic Catholic church filled with art
description: Grand Catholic church with an elaborate interior featuring many frescoes & stained-glass windows.

name: Amsterdamse Bos
tagline: Vast park with forest, canal & goat farm
description: Recreational area including an organic farm/petting zoo, tree-top adventure course & boat trips.

name: Hash, Marihuana & Hemp Museum
description: Stalwart showcase for historical & cultural exhibits relating to cannabis, including a live garden.
